title: REVIEW  ---  Play:  News Quiz  ----  By Daniel Akst
text:
1. Low interest rates demanded by Turkish President Erdogan have pummeled the country's currency. About how many lira buy a dollar?

A. 11

B. 110

C. 1,100

D. 11,000

---

2. Who's aiming to raise $90 million by selling "stock" that doesn't give buyers any financial benefit?

A. The Universal Baseball Association

B. The Atlanta Braves

C. The Green Bay Packers

D. Manchester United

---

3. Who said they would launch a self-service repair program next year?

A. The Hospital for Special Surgery

B. Samsung

C. Dell

D. Apple

---

4. Friday was a big day for Beaver Moon. Why?

A. The poet and activist debuted as a host on Jeopardy.

B. Warren Moon's grandson started a game as an NFL quarterback.

C. Treated for glaucoma, she rejoined her colony on Beaver Pond in Quebec.

D. It's a nickname for an eclipse of the full moon in November.

---

5. The mayor of Fitzgerald, Ga., lost a reelection bid over a scheme to lure tourists by building the world's tallest topiary -- in the shape of what?

A. A peanut

B. A peach tree

C. A chicken

D. Jimmy Carter

---

6. N26 said it will end U.S. operations next year. What is it?

A. A chain of bakeries offering 26 flavors of naan bread

B. A mobile bank and financial tech company

C. A literary journal and lifestyle entity

D. A numerologically named network of "natural" spas

---

7. The SEC is probing claims that a company manipulated research results for a new Alzheimer's drug, causing its stock to soar. Which company?

A. Cassava Sciences

B. Taro Pharmaceuticals

C. Jicama Therapeutics

D. Galangal Biologics

---

8. The Women's Tennis Association is worried about a Chinese tennis star who's disappeared. Which one?

A. Li Na

B. Peng Shuai

C. Wang Xinyu

D. Zheng Jie

---

ANSWERS

1. A

2. C

3. D

4. D

5. C

6. B

7. A

8. B
